units.title: Pool PSC lines before organoid generation
units.text: we pooled PSC lines (5,000 cells per line) before organoid generation we benchmarked them with ground truth priors using (1) five in silico multiplexed datasets with varying degree of balance among genotypes and (2) two ad hoc experiments in which the different genotypes were barcode tagged before pooling.
units.rationale: Pooling cells establishes the multiplexed starting material for downstream organoid culture and benchmarking.

units.title: Assess proliferation via flow cytometry
units.text: we longitudinally assessed the proliferation rate of organoids derived from individual lines in two differentiation replicates through flow cytometry-based cell cycle analysis.
units.rationale: Measuring proliferation tracks growth dynamics across lines and time points.

units.title: Immunofluorescence characterization of mCBOs
units.text: We first characterized mCBOs by immunofluorescence for canonical markers of neurodevelopment previously defined for organoids and confirmed their expected expression patterns (Fig. 2a,b and Extended Data Fig. 1a–c).
units.rationale: Immunofluorescence validates that organoids express expected neurodevelopmental markers.

units.title: Develop SCanSNP computational method
units.text: we developed a new computational method, SCanSNP, and a consensus call to deconvolve cell identities, overcoming current criticalities in doublets and low-quality cell identification.
units.rationale: SCanSNP provides a tool to assign genotypes and filter artefacts in multiplexed single‑cell data.

units.title: Demultiplexing with multiple algorithms
units.text: we performed demultiplexing again using all the above tools.
units.rationale: Re‑running demultiplexing with all tools enables comparison of their performance on the same dataset.

units.title: Two‑pronged experimental approach
units.text: we used a two-pronged approach. First, we longitudinally assessed the proliferation rate of organoids derived from individual lines in two differentiation replicates through flow cytometry-based cell cycle analysis.
units.rationale: Combining proliferation assessment with later multiplexing addresses both biological and technical variability.

units.title: Pooling PSCs during organoid generation vs. before scRNA‑seq
units.text: pooling PSCs from different individuals either during organoid generation, or before scRNA-seq library preparation.
units.rationale: Describes the two distinct multiplexing strategies evaluated in the study.

units.title: Longitudinal scRNA‑seq profiling of mCBOs
units.text: we longitudinally profiled the resulting mCBOs through scRNA-seq at 50, 100 and 300 d of differentiation, following the same protocol previously used and benchmarked in our laboratory.
units.rationale: Serial scRNA‑seq captures developmental trajectories across multiple time points.

units.title: Benchmark demultiplexing with simulated and barcode‑tagged datasets
units.text: we benchmarked them with ground truth priors using (1) five in silico multiplexed datasets with varying degree of balance among genotypes and (2) two ad hoc experiments in which the different genotypes were barcode tagged before pooling.
units.rationale: Using both simulated and experimental ground truth allows objective evaluation of demultiplexing accuracy.

units.title: Consensus call framework for genotype identification
units.text: we set a consensus call framework merging their outcomes into one combined output (Fig. 3b).
units.rationale: Integrating multiple tool outputs improves robustness of genotype assignment.
